title.narrative: Improve Financial Sustainability Through Value Addition and Marketing of Products

description.narrative: Interaction program with member cooperatives for the purpose of fund raising to establish a federation retail outlet and widening the product range. Sufficient funds raised to establish a retail outlet in primary location where member cooperatives products are sold Selection of 5 new cooperative for product diversification of the farmers as per OVOP model 5 different product will be introduced to the market which is expected to cover operational cost of federation from 2020 onwards SFACFL Makwanpur retail outlet establishment in central area of market Easy acccess of cooperative members to market and shorten the value chain Reveiw market strategy and business plan of DACF shop based on experience to 2018 Developed clear understanding of the market supply and demand Interaction program with producer farmer for supply of commodities to be introduced in retail outlet Secure the supply of commodities from the farmers. Promotional activities and advertisement for the current portfolio of products Better information dissemination to the consumers leading to awareness about the products offered by the federation via retail outlet Evaluation of the 1 year action plan Updated with the progress reached yet so far Purchase seed extraction machine for killing chilly Facilitation on Commercial production chilly seeds Interaction program in target markets identified during the business planning session in 2018 for seed marketing Broaden the seed market at National level Seed marketing and promotion activities (coordination with P.6) Improve sales and seed business Conduct feedback and crop performance survey (Baseline and endline survey) Yeilds and performance of crop anaysis to be used for marketing of the seeds Contact NARC for certification of vegetable seeds if possible. Implementation due November 2019 certification of seed business DSA to Manager (Interation with cooperative members/farmers to ensure follow-up of the advise provided by expert and secure supply of the improved seeds) Successful implementation of program Assist in purchase of packing of materials for seed to 3 cooperatives Facilitation in selection of packing materials Make the portable pouch sealer available for use by the cooperatives for packing samples Availability of sealing machine all coops Follow up and field visit by JTA (6-8 month) Support to the farmers to implement the advisory support provided by expert from ENZA

SFACFL Makwanpur provides services to its members with the main aim to improve the income of the farmers. In 2017 the coordination between Agriterra DAF and ENZA resulted in initiation of marketing of three products: turmeric maize flour and honey with the brand name of "Kisan ko" (literally means farmers') on behalf of six primary cooperative with the expectation of better price to farmers and generating more income to DAF. With technical support from ENZA Zaden DAF also supported three member cooperatives to improve local seeds of broad leaf mustard hot pepper and black beans. DAF has a goal of moving from donor dependency to generating sustainable own source of income through internal capitalization and marketing. With this goal in mind the focus on 2019 will be to scale up the marketing of agricultural products and seeds which benefits large number of farmers. Agriterra will support the federation through Business plan development for the retail outlets marketing and promotional activities via business development manager including the collaboration with ENZA to improve quality of seeds on broad leaf mustard black beans and hot pepper.

This year the federation will unite the potential cooperative to raise the fund for the cooperative outlet. The DACF will establish a long term business under the cooperative brand to promote the small farmers product through the cooperatives. Further product range will be widen upto sell under cooperative logo on OVOP (One Village One Product) basis.The estimated turnover from this year may increase up to 3 million Nepalese Rupees with the opening of outlet in the market. Additional 5 wholeseller 10 traders and 20 retailers for product sales will be contracted. The federation is expected to be financially independent from any donors at the end of 2019 to cover its operational cost. In addition the federation will play a key role in commercialization of the improved seeds with support from ENZA Zaden. The goal for 2020 is to fully operationalize the federations' Cooperative Mart (sales outlet) and have the federation be financially independent in its operations. In addition the federation will play a key role in the commercialization of the improved seeds which were produced with support from ENZA Zaden until 2019.
